item.title: 日本央行提高政策利率后日元仍下跌，收益率差距依然存在
item.description: 即使在日本央行提高利率之后，日元仍然下跌，因为投资者权衡了这个亚洲国家与其他主要经济体之间仍然存在的巨大收益率差异。【原文：The yen dropped even after the Bank of Japan raised interest rates as investors weighed what remains a wide yield differential between the Asian nation and other major economies.】

item.title: 刺激经济呼声高涨，中国股市迎来四月以来最佳交易日
item.description: 中国股市跳涨，在岸基准股指有望创下三个多月来的最佳表现，原因是市场对中国政府扶持陷入困境的经济的预期日益高涨。【原文：Chinese stocks jumped, with the onshore benchmark gauge poised for its best day in over three months, as anticipation grew for Beijing to bolster its struggling economy.】

item.description: 澳大利亚联邦银行（Commonwealth Bank of Australia）一举超越全球最大的矿业公司必和必拓集团（BHP Group Ltd.），成为澳大利亚最有价值的公司。【原文：Commonwealth Bank of Australia has shot past the world’s biggest miner BHP Group Ltd. and is now the country’s most valuable company.】

item.title: 日本央行将在美联储前数小时决定利率
item.description: 2024年6月14日星期五，日本东京，日本央行行长上田一夫在央行总部举行的新闻发布会上。日本央行让投资者等到7月份的会议上再了解缩减购债规模的细节，这引发日元再度走软，并推低了加息押注。摄影师：Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg【原文：Kazuo Ueda, governor of the Bank of Japan (BOJ), during a news conference at the central bank's headquarters in Tokyo, Japan, on Friday, June 14, 2024. The Bank of Japan is making investors wait until its July meeting for details on its paring of bond buying, sparking renewed weakness in the yen and a pushing back of bets on an interest rate hike. Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg】

item.title: 中国任命新市场副主席接替改革派方星海
item.description: 中国任命了一位新官员担任市场监管机构副主任，接替长期倡导改革和开放资本市场的方星海。【原文：China has appointed a new official as deputy chief at its markets regulator to replace Fang Xinghai, a long-time advocate for reform and open capital markets.】

item.title: 中国人民银行即将出售债券，中国地区银行面临债券逆转风险
item.description: 在今年史无前例的债券大涨引发央行发出一系列警告之后，中国的地区贷款机构在中国 4.3 万亿美元的主权债务市场上正面临着越来越大的风险。【原文：China’s regional lenders are facing growing risks in the nation’s $4.3 trillion sovereign debt market after an unprecedented bond rally this year prompted a slew of warnings from the central bank.】

item.title: 出口繁荣、美联储转向，林吉特将加速好转
item.description: 得益于强劲的经济增长和对美联储即将降息的预期，马来西亚林吉特的反弹步伐正在加快。【原文：The Malaysian ringgit’s rebound is gathering pace, thanks to stronger growth and expectations of an impending interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 末日博士 "努里埃尔-鲁比尼希望推出首只 ETF
item.description: 经济学家努里埃尔-鲁比尼（Nouriel Roubini）因在 2008 年金融危机前发出灾难警告而赢得了 "末日博士 "的称号，他正期待着成为最新一位在 9.4 万亿美元的 ETF 领域大显身手的华尔街资深人士。【原文：Economist Nouriel Roubini, who earned the “Dr. Doom” moniker for his warnings of disaster ahead of the 2008 financial crisis, is looking to become the latest high-profile Wall Street veteran to make their mark in the $9.4 trillion ETF universe.】

item.title: 新加坡镍丑闻清算人寻求收回 8.55 亿新元：ST
item.description: 据《海峡时报》（Straits Times）报道，涉嫌镍矿诈骗犯吴裕智（Ng Yu Zhi）旗下三家公司的清算人正在寻求法院命令，以从吴裕智及其他三人手中追回约 8.55 亿新元（约合 6.37 亿美元）。【原文：The liquidators of alleged nickel fraudster Ng Yu Zhi’s three companies are seeking a court order to recover about S$855 million ($637 million) from Ng and three others, the Straits Times reported.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲

item.title: 中国企业盈利复苏蹒跚，考验投资者信心

item.title: 行业报告显示美国再次削减石油库存后，石油价格上涨

item.title: 日元在日本央行和美联储之前保持 2022 年以来最大月度涨幅
item.description: 日元保持着一年半以来的最大月度涨幅，投资者翘首以待央行周三的决定，这些决定可能延续涨势，也可能使涨势逆转。【原文：The yen held onto its biggest monthly gain in a year-and-a-half as investors waited on tenterhooks for central bank decisions Wednesday that may extend the rally or send it into reverse.】

item.title: 世茂与时代中国在债务计划谈判中重返法庭
item.description: 中国开发商世茂集团控股有限公司（Shimao Group Holdings Ltd.）和时代中国控股有限公司（Times China Holdings Ltd.）周三将在香港出庭受审，两家公司都希望证明自己在债务重组方面取得了足够的进展，从而避免被法院下达清盘令。【原文：Chinese developers Shimao Group Holdings Ltd. and Times China Holdings Ltd. head to court in Hong Kong Wednesday, where they will each aim to show that they have made enough progress on debt restructuring to avoid liquidation orders.】

item.title: 捷蓝航空将忠诚计划视为潜在的抵押品来源

item.title: 共和党人称哈里斯为边境沙皇。她到底在移民事务中扮演什么角色？
item.description: 卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）有可能成为民主党提名的美国总统候选人，这促使共和党重新开始攻击她作为拜登政府 "边境沙皇 "的表现。众议院议长迈克-约翰逊称她 "无能"。众议院共和党人投票谴责她 "未能确保 "边境安全，并有六名民主党人加入了这项象征性的决议。【原文：Kamala Harris’ ascent as the likely Democratic nominee for US president spurred a revival of the Republican attack on her performance as the Biden administration’s “border czar.” House Speaker Mike Johnson called her “inept” in that role. House Republicans voted to condemn her “failure to secure” the border and got six Democrats to join the symbolic resolution.】
